result.execSummary:
The defendant Marie Alice Hoaglan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court ordered defendant to pay surcharge, plus costs and disbursements, during the probationary period in 14CF1130. Failure to pay amounts in full would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant.

Release to the Day Reporting Center
Consecutive to: to any other sentence

Defendant Marie Alice Hoaglan not in court.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Bail Forfeiture Hearing proceeds.  In Court is Surety, Cienna Alonso.  Statements heard from parties.  Court ordered $200.00 bail to be returned, $300.00 remains forfeited.
Defendant's Bail Forfeiture HEARING Notice returned undeliverable.
Case is scheduled for BAIL/BOND FORFEITURE HEARING ON 03-06-2015 at 9:00 a.m. before Judge Jeffrey Kremers. Notices mailed to defendant and surety.
Case is scheduled for BAIL/BOND FORFEITURE HEARING ON 03-06-2015 at 9:00 a.m. before Judge Jeffrey Kremers. Notices mailed to defendant and surety.
Cash bond is reinstated in order to be scheduled for 3-6-2015 Bail Forfeited Hearing.
Letter from surety on case requesting bail money be returned to her (requesting bail hearing).

Surety came in today to complete a yellow Request For BF Hearing card, but bail has already been forfeited.
Surety was given a copy of form letter 1969 R-25 explaining how to request another hearing.
Hand delivered by Carloyn M.
No reply from surety or defendant
Surety's Bail Forfeiture Notice returned undeliverable.
Notice of bail/bond forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant; Original in file. ($500.00) ad

Defendant Marie Alice Hoaglan in court with attorney Alexis Ray Liggins.  Defendant Marie Alice Hoaglan in custody.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pursuant to negotiations, the State moved to dismiss but read in Count 1.  Court granted State's motion and ordered Count 1 dismissed and read in.

AS TO COUNT 02:  
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant sworn, examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in Count 2 of the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  

Sentencing proceeded. Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by:  defendant's mother, Ms. Patricia G.  The Court ordered the following:

The Court imposed 6 months at the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with release to the Day Reporting Center; credit for 4 days time served.

 * Court ordered defefemdant to pay a DNA surcharge, plus costs and disbursements, during the probationary period in 14CF1130.  Failure to pay amounts in full would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant.

Filed,
Pretrial Incarceration Credit form;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Bench warrant cleared by Milwaukee County Sheriff on 7/25/14.  
Bench Warrant in file.  Case is adjourned for return on bench warrant in Branch 20.

Defendant Marie Alice Hoaglan in court with attorney Alexis Ray Liggins.  Defendant Marie Alice Hoaglan in custody.  Tyron St Junior via telephone for Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for plea and sentencing.  Defendant had court in Waukesha County this morning and was taken into custody.  Case remains calendared in Branch 20.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 500.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Marie Alice Hoaglan not in court.  Denis Stingl appeared on behalf of Lucy Kronforst for the State of Wisconsin.Entry made without file.  Defendant failing to comply with the conditions of supervision (was discharged from Justice), Court ordered a bench warrant to be issued.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Possible victim identified therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.

Defendant Marie Alice Hoaglan in court with attorney Alexis R Liggins.  Jay R Pucek appeared on behalf of Lucy Kronforst for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested a plea date; to be determined if defendant is eligible for drug treatment court.  Court granted defense request and ordered all conditions of bail to continue. Defendant Marie Alice Hoaglan in court with attorney Alexis R Liggins.  Randy Sitzberger for Lucy J Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision. No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Kohls, 3737 South 27th Street, Milwaukee, WI.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Marie Alice Hoaglan in court with attorney Victoria M McCandless.  Defendant Marie Alice Hoaglan in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. Court entered a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the Defendant to Count 2. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 22, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
